content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron Plate Production Line (Position x=1-3, y=1-3.5)
Consists of:
- Two stone furnaces at (1,1) and (3,1)
- Two burner inserters at (1.5,2.5) and (3.5,2.5)
- Two wooden chests containing iron plates at (1.5,3.5) and (3.5,3.5)

### Copper Plate Production Line (Position x=2-4, y=7-9.5)
Consists of:
- Two stone furnaces at (2,7) and (4,7)
- Two burner inserters at (2.5,8.5) and (4.5,8.5)
- Two wooden chests at (2.5,9.5) containing copper plates and (4.5,9.5)
- Additional burner inserter at (3.5,9.5) moving items between chests

### Assembly Line 1 - Copper Cable Production (Position x=14.5, y=11.5-14.5)
Consists of:
- Input chest containing iron plates at (14.5,11.5)
- Burner inserter at (14.5,12.5)
- Assembling machine 1 at (14.5,14.5) set to produce copper cable
- Output system with chest at (11.5,14.5) containing copper cables
- Burner inserter at (12.5,14.5) moving finished products

### Assembly Line 2 - Electronic Circuit Production (Position x=21.5, y=11.5-15.5)
Consists of:
- Input chest containing iron plates at (21.5,11.5)
- Burner inserter at (21.5,13.5)
- Assembling machine 1 at (21.5,15.5) set to produce electronic circuits
- Additional chest at (21.5,12.5) and chest at (17.5,14.5) for components

### Power Generation System (Position x=2.5-13.5, y=35.5)
Consists of:
- Offshore pump at (2.5,35.5)
- Boiler at (7.0,35.5)
- Steam engine at (13.5,35.5)
- Connected pipe network for water flow
- Multiple pipe groups forming water and steam connections

### Transport System
Multiple belt groups connecting various production facilities:
- Belt systems running north-south for material transport
- Belt systems running east-west connecting assembly lines
- Complex network of belts connecting furnaces to assembly machines

ERROR TIPS

### Power-related errors
- Ensure boilers have fuel (coal) to generate power for assembling machines
- Connect all electrical consumers to the power network properly

### Assembly machine errors
- Make sure all required input materials are available in input chests
- Verify proper connections between input chests and assembly machines
- Ensure power is supplied to assembly machines before starting production

### Resource management errors
- Keep track of coal supply for burner inserters and boilers
- Make sure to have necessary materials in inventory before attempting insertions

### Fluid system errors
- Ensure proper connection of pipes between offshore pump, boiler, and steam engine
- Verify fluid flow direction in pipe networks
